channel.title: Retrieving amount of players from .txt file generated by server?
channel.description:
Hey Mopar :D
I currently have my server fully updating players online to an image but i want it to update to my website where i already have a set row for the "text" to update.
My server is fully sending the number of players here currently : http://deadlyslash.com/new/online.php but i need it to send on my default page which i will upload in a bit after i finish it and il post a screenie here in where i want the players online to appear.. its currently updating to an image but i want it to update to "text" meaning it can be highlighted and all that fun stuff ;)

item.title: Retrieving amount of players from .txt file generated by server?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

MYSQL is the way to go.

In the rsc section there is ‘easy rsc’ which saves players with flat files. Somebody made a script to load players online…
sec…

Edit : I cbf to find the online counter… but here is a script to get you started, maybe you will learn something.

[code]EasyRSC Stat Checker

<?php error_reporting(0); $exps = array(83, 174, 276, 388, 512, 650, 801, 969, 1154, 1358, 1584, 1833, 2107, 2411, 2746, 3115, 3523, 3973, 4470, 5018, 5624, 6291, 7028, 7842, 8740, 9730, 10824, 12031, 13363, 14833, 16456, 18247, 20224, 22406, 24815, 27473, 30408, 33648, 37224, 41171, 45529, 50339, 55649, 61512, 67983, 75127, 83014, 91721, 101333, 111945, 123660, 136594, 150872, 166636, 184040, 203254, 224466, 247886, 273742, 302288, 333804, 368599, 407015, 449428, 496254, 547953, 605032, 668051, 737627, 814445, 899257, 992895, 1096278, 1210421, 1336443, 1475581, 1629200, 1798808, 1986068, 2192818, 2421087, 2673114,2951373, 3258594, 3597792, 3972294, 4385776, 4842295, 5346332, 5902831, 6517253, 7195629, 7944614, 8771558, 9684577, 10692629, 11805606, 13034431, 14391160); function experience_to_level($exp) { global $exps; for($level = 0;$level < 98;$level++) { if($exp >= $exps[$level]) { continue; } return ($level + 1); } return 99; } if(isset($_POST['submit'])){ $username = trim($_POST['username']); $username = str_replace(" ", "_", $username); $file="C:\Users\Zorian\Downloads\RSC\NOOBscape V3\Server\players\\" . $username . ".cfg"; $skill = array( 'Attack', 'Defense', 'Strength', 'Hits', 'Ranged', 'Prayer', 'Magic', 'Cooking', 'Woodcut', 'Fletching', 'Fishing', 'Firemaking', 'Crafting', 'Smithing', 'Mining', 'Herblaw', 'Agility', 'Thieving' ); if (file_exists($file) && is_readable($file)) { $settings=parse_ini_file($file); $username = str_replace("_", " ", $username); print "Currently viewing stats of: $username"; for ($i = 0; $i < count($skill); $i++) { print "
" . ($skill[$i]) . " " . experience_to_level($settings["e" . ($i + 1)]) . " " . $settings["e" . ($i + 1)] . "
"; } } else { die("Error: Account does not exist"); } } else { echo" Username: "; } ?> [/code]

@justaguy wrote:

Bad idea. Use SQL and put it in a database.
[/quote]why would it be a bad idea? i don’t have the best amount of knowledge with websites and their languages, so it’s a serious question. it seems that if they have an unlimited amount of space and CPU in their webhost, i don’t really think it would be a problem.[/quote]

In a nutshell it would probably be a lot easier.

item.source: Retrieving amount of players from .txt file generated by server?

item.title: Retrieving amount of players from .txt file generated by server?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

it’s virtually the same thing as making it update an image. just rearrange some of your code and make it apply to the text file.

quick [poor example] dummy class:

$ip = $REMOTE_ADDR; // $REMOTE_ADDR gets the users ip address 
$time = time(); // this adds the time of day to the script,,, 
$found = 0; // how many users found, aka: ip address for start 
$users = 0; // number of users determined for start 
$user = ""; // users know already,,, aka: no users yet 

if (!is_file("online.txt")) // text file used for figuring how man users online.	
{ 
$s = fopen("online.txt","w"); //creates file if not one 
fclose($s); 
chmod("online.txt",0666); // chmod filt 
} 

$f = fopen("online.txt","r+"); // opens file 
flock($f,2); 

while (!feof($f)) 
{ 
$user[] = chop(fgets($f,65536)); 
} 

fseek($f,0,SEEK_SET); 
ftruncate($f,0); 

foreach ($user as $line) // configures each user, no doubles 
{ 
list($savedip,$savedtime) = split("\|",$line); 
if ($savedip == $ip) {$savedtime = $time;$found = 1;} 
{ 
fputs($f,"$savedip|$savedtime\n"); 
$users = $users + 1; 
} 
} 

if ($found == 0) // writes to file 
{ 
fputs($f,"$ip|$time\n"); 
$users = $users + 1; 
} 

fclose ($f); 
print 'Users Viewing Site : '.$users;

Read full topic
